channel.title: Mastodon Home Timeline
channel.description: RSS feed for the Mastodon Home timeline

item.title: Spencer LaVere Smith
item.description: Job Ad: UC Santa Barbara: Assistant Professor- Tenure Track Position in the Broad Area of Autonomous Robotic Systems. https://recruit.ap.ucsb.edu/JPF02590 The Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering at the University of California, Santa Barbara (UCSB) is accepting applications for a tenure track position at the Assistant Professor level in the broad area of Autonomous Robotic Systems. The Department has particular (but non-exclusive) interest in applicants with expertise in machine learning, artificial intelligence, and/or controls, along with the ability to complement existing faculty strengths in fields such as automation, robotics, computer vision, optimization, and signal processing.

item.title: Spencer LaVere Smith
item.description:
Another job at at UC Santa Barbara: https://recruit.ap.ucsb.edu/JPF02597
Tenure- track Assistant Professor level in autonomous systems and robotics. in the MechE dept.

item.title: Gabi Purcaru
item.description: @mapto @ChrisWilms23 @neilhoskins @helenczerski @davidho @freemo The way Followgraph is implemented is meant to preseve privacy: it uses inauthenticated requests to make sure Followgraph does not need to receive or store user data.Specifically, it uses this API endpoint: https://docs.joinmastodon.org/methods/accounts/#followingThe documentation says "**OAuth:** Public". Some implementations accept inauthenticated requests, but some choose not to.This is why Followgraph doesn't always work.

item.title: Carsen Stringer (she/her)
item.description: **Job Ad** Join us! Janelia is looking for collaborative *Group Leaders* whose research interests align with our biology-focused Research Areas, Mechanistic Cognitive Neuroscience & 4D Cellular Physiology, or our core research areas, Computation & Theory and Molecular Tools & Imaging, or some combo of these areas. To learn more about the specific scientific topics we are actively recruiting for, please refer to the information available here: https://www.janelia.org/our-research/our-labs/group-leaders. The application deadline is 3:00 p.m. on November 1.

item.title: Dhananjay Thakur
item.description: https://www.embopress.org/doi/full/10.15252/embj.201695709Wondering just how much PFA was messing with my immunostaining, stumbled upon this paper that compares glyoxal to PFA as a fixative agent. Seems to work a lot better than PFA in a majority of the tissues they tested. Drosophilists of Mastodon, what are your thoughts on using glyoxal as a fixative agent for brains and other tissues? If you've tried it, how has it worked out?#drosophila #biochemistry #neuroscience #microscopy

item.title: Lana Sinapayen
item.description: This is just unacceptable. Mike has been fired for expressing distress at the treatment of civilians in Pal-stine. He's Jewish and has been fired after harassment by a lot of non Jewish people and one Jewish guy who posts memes. The ECAG fought for him as much as we could. He has the support of many ECRs all across the world. He is an example of leadership, innovation, and listening to the disenfranchised for many of us. I am so sorry.https://twitter.com/mbeisen/status/1716556747710574931?t=HM8sNVyKaSRLIKusb_nRuw&s=19

item.title: Boris Barbour
item.description: This seems an insane decision to me. I have signed the petition in support of Michael Eisen.https://www.science.org/content/article/prominent-journal-editor-fired-endorsing-satirical-article-israel-hamas

item.title: Lana Sinapayen
item.description: I have resigned from my position in eLife's Early Career Advisory Group. The ECAG works very hard to advance eLife's mission and represents a sizable portion of the organization's budget. We're not just randos sitting around doing nothing. It was an honor to serve such an innovative organization. The recent overblown, fabricated scandal brought the worst of academic politics to the surface. Mike was more gracious in his exit than I could ever be and I'm glad he'll never see my resignation email.

item.title: International Brain Laboratory
item.description: Going to SfN this year? Join us for a workshop on how to use the IBL Brainwide Map dataset to test your own hypotheses! For more information and to register, visit http://internationalbrainlab.org/sfn2023

item.title: Jeffrey C. Erlich
item.description:
Is food addiction real? Apparently if it is ‚Äúultra-processed‚Äùhttps://www.theguardian.com/food/2023/oct/12/its-like-trying-to-quit-smoking-why-are-1-in-7-of-us-addicted-to-ultra-processed-foods
As Van Tulleken explains, ‚ÄúAddictive products are not addictive for everyone. Almost 90% of people can try alcohol and not develop a problematic relationship; many can try cigarettes, or even cocaine.‚Äù Equally, not everyone who eats UPFs will become addicted ‚Äì but, based on current studies, one in seven will. ‚ÄúMany UPFs for many people are addictive,‚Äù Van Tulleken summarises. ‚ÄúAnd when people experience food addiction, it is almost always to UPF products.‚Äù
#addiction #food #science #sugar #fat

item.title: International Brain Laboratory
item.description:
We are excited to present a Brain-Wide Map of neural activity during a complex decision-making behavior, a product of the monumental effort of 22 labs: 547 Neuropixels recordings in 267 brain regions from 115 mice collected in 11 labs üê≠ (1/8)
https://www.biorxiv.org/content/10.1101/2023.07.04.547681v2
#neuroscience

item.title: Earl K. Miller
item.description:
Working memory for different items linked to distinct beta phases. Theta phase coordinates beta activity, preventing memory conflicts.Rhythmic temporal coordination of neural activity prevents representational conflict during working memory
https://doi.org/10.1016/j.cub.2023.03.088
#neuroscience

item.title: Nicole Rust
item.description:
JUDICIOUS MODEL ROBUSTIFICATIONReading George Box's 1979 paper that gave rise to the famous phrase "All models are wrong but some are useful."
https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/abs/pii/B9780124381506500182That phrase is just so great. It's easy to see how it's counterpart slipped through the cracks. "Judicious model robustification" - who can claim not to aspire to that as well?To all modelers out there, may your model be judiciously robustified!#complexity #neuroscience
